intro: Microstylis khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi microstylis, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
